result.execSummary:
The defendant John E Edwards was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Disorderly Conduct [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse], a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

parties.name: Waukesha County Clerk of Circuit Court

supervisions.notes: Probation may be terminated after six months if all conditions have been met and Agent approves.

miscConds.notes:
Court costs ($343) are to be paid as a Condition of Probation.

  If probation is revoked and a prison term is not ordered, or if probation is discharged/terminated, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and government entities for outstanding financial obligations.  Collection may include income assignment.

Anger Management and/or Domestic Violence Counseling deemed necessary by Agent.
No violent contact with the victim.

records.addlTxt: with Elements of criminal offenses to which plea is being entered.

Defendant John E Edwards in court with attorney M. Elizabeth Weathers.  Brian J. Juech appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Defendant enters a guilty plea as to count 2 and count 1 is dismissed and read-in. Court imposed the following sentence: 

60 days county jail with huber STAYED and placed on probation for 12 months.
CONDITIONS: 
 Anger management and/or domestic violence counseling to be determined by Agent.  
No violent contact with the victim.
Court costs of $243.00, $100.00 domestic abuse surcharge, costs to be paid as condition of probation
Probation may serve in Milwaukee County
 Agent can terminate probation early if conditions are met after 6 months.
Plea/sentencing hearing on May 28, 2015 at 11:00 am.

Bryan C. Bayer appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant John E Edwards in court with attorney M. Elizabeth Weathers.  
File not called on the record.
  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for May 28, 2015 at 11:00 am.
Defendant is not to have any violent contact with the victim/witness listed in the complaint.   Defendant to comply with I.D. Processing

Defendant John E Edwards in court.  Timothy F. Westphal appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court advises of right to an attorney.  NOT GUILTY PLEA ENTERED BY COURT.
  Hearing scheduled for April 13, 2015 at 10:30 am.
